data.title: App Store Developers Made About $60 Billion in 2021, Apple Says
data.description: App Store Developers Made About $60 Billion in 2021, Apple Says

data.title: Apple implies it generated record revenue from the App Store during 2021
data.description: Apple said Monday that it paid developers $60 billion in 2021, a figure that suggests that App Store sales continue to grow at a rapid clip.

data.title: Big Tech could brush off rate hikes. Startups may struggle
data.description: Apple, Microsoft, SoFi and Coinbase all sold off sharply this week, as investors, anticipating higher interest rates, dumped tech stocks and bought shares of companies they believed were undervalued.

data.title: Grab Apple's AirPods Max at the steepest discount we've ever seen
Macy's shortens store hours as COVID-19 cases surge
data.description: Macy's Inc will reduce its US store hours for the rest of January as it prepares for potential COVID-19 cases among workers with the Omicron variant driving up infections across the United States.

data.title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams to big banks: We need you back in the office
data.description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams is not pleased with the shift back to remote work by Wall Street banks and other major employers in the Big Apple.

data.title: Verdict in fraud case of Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes offers lessons for investors
data.description: Theranos isn’t the only bad apple out there. Here’s how you can protect yourself and your portfolio from corporate fraud.

data.title: Warren Buffett makes over $120 billion on Apple's rise to $3 trillion, among his best bets ever
data.description: The 5% Apple stake Berkshire Hathaway acquired in 2018 for $36 billion is now worth more than $160 billion as the tech giant hit $3 trillion milestone.
